chapter.para: Once your cluster is ready, you may want to deploy additional software that is not installed on &productname; by default. This chapter provides instructions on how to install and configure various tools and services.

sect1.title: Deploying &helm; and &tiller;
sect1.para: &helm; charts provide a standard way to deploy &kube; applications. While &tiller; (the &helm;'s server-side component) is not installed on &productname; by default, it can be installed by enabling the appropriate option in the Velum graphical interface. When the Install &tiller; option is enabled, &tiller; is installed as a container on a &productname; 2 cluster from the installation media.

Once &tiller; is installed on &productname; 2 cluster, the &helm; client can be used to interact with &tiller; and the cluster. To initialize the &helm; client (which automatically discovers &tiller; in the cluster), run the helm init --client-only command. You can then use the &helm; client as described in the official documentation at .

note.title: &helm; and &tiller; are Optional
note.para: Both &helm; and &tiller; are optional, unless you plan to run a &suse; Cloud Application Platform.

important.title: Technology Preview
important.para: Even though you can install and use the community &kube; dashboard, &productname; currently fully supports only &dashboard;.

listitem.para: Heapster version 1.3.0 or later needs to be installed on the cluster
Helm version 2.7.2+ and kubectl version 1.8.0+ recommended
